content: New Yorkers often say this: "our most prestigious and oldest university that frequently tops the ranking of our undergraduate institutions, with neoclassical architecture, a journalism school, a medical school, and a campus set in the heart of the city". What is the name of the university?

I believe the university being referred to is New York University, commonly known as NYU. It is indeed one of the most prestigious and oldest universities in New York City, often topping rankings for undergraduate institutions. NYU is renowned for its neoclassical architecture, particularly visible in its Washington Square Park campus, which is centrally located in the Greenwich Village neighborhood. The university is also home to highly respected schools, including the NYU Journalism Institute and the NYU Grossman School of Medicine. Its central city location provides students with unparalleled access to the cultural and professional opportunities that New York City offers.
